etymology.description: Pictogram: a person facing forward; original form of 夫, later phonetically borrowed for “big”.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicts a human figure viewed from the front, not necessarily with exaggerated outstretched arms. The graph was later borrowed to write the word pronounced dà ‘big’, while 夫 specialized for ‘man’. The modern shape still evokes a torso with two legs and an arm stroke.

examples.chinese: 这个房间很大(這個房間很大)。
他是我们家最大的孩子(他是我們家最大的孩子)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì wǒmen jiā zuì dà de háizi.
examples.english: He is the eldest child in our family.

examples.chinese: 大学开学了(大學開學了)。
